result.execSummary:
All charges against Melissa Marie Sommerfelt in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Melissa Marie Sommerfelt is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Marie Sommerfelt

defendant.name: Sommerfelt, Melissa Marie
defendant.address: 4389 South Pennsylvania Avenue, St. Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MB

Defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Motion to dismiss by the defense, argued and GRANTED by the Court.
Court will hold the defendant for 48 hours to give the State time to reissue.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Melissa Marie Sommerfelt not in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/05/2022@1:30pm
